page.title: 13The Church,Tiptree
page.content: On 30th June Crispin and I sent a letter to the rector. We asked if we could see how many births,deaths and marriages have taken place in 1985. We received a reply from the rector saying that on July 3rd after school we could go and look at the church records. When we arrived at the rectory the rector took us to a room where all the church records were kept. First of all we were shown how many deaths had taken place at the church which was seven. They were cremated at Colchester because it was cheaper. Then we looked at how many baptisms that had taken place which was fifteen. Then we looked at how many marriages have taken place which was fifteen. When we had this information we thanked the rector and went home.
